definition: a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)

sentences.english: I found myself in an entirely new world the moment I arrived in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我一到北京就感到耳目一新。

sentences.english: It was an approach to business that was fresh and appealing to me.
sentences.chinese: 这样的经商态度令我耳目一新，也为之心折。

sentences.english: What a special design airport, It is refreshing you after arriving Xiamen.
sentences.chinese: 好特别的机场，一落机已经令你有耳目一新的感觉。

sentences.english: To a person living aline, it's important to stay absence can be refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 若与别人同住，你会在与他们小别时感觉耳目一新。

sentences.english: For a refreshing twist try making “Rosebud Ice Cubes.”
sentences.chinese: 一个令人耳目一新的尝试是做“玫瑰花蕾冰块”。

sentences.english: If you live with other people, their temporary absence can be refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 若与别人同住，你会在与他们小别时感觉耳目一新。

sentences.english: Concise and contemporary blue mosaic partition wall, your person finds everything new and fresh.
sentences.chinese: 简洁现代的蓝色马赛克隔断墙，令人耳目一新。

sentences.english: What is refreshing is the author's easy, conversational style.
sentences.chinese: 让人耳目一新的是作者轻松自如的会话式写作风格。

sentences.english: This is my first time to watch Elva's new look and her sharp change .
sentences.chinese: 这还是我首次看到她这种新形象，让人耳目一新。

sentences.english: Wonderful design, bring you refreshing feeling.
sentences.chinese: 超炫的界面设计，让你耳目一新。

definition: having a unique or distinctive style
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
stunning/breathtaking
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to be full of praise (idiom)
to feast one's eyes
novelty/new and odd
